= Examples and Tutorials =

==!MudVolley Tutorials==

The !MudVolley Tutorials are the main JGF tutorials. Through this courses you will build a small game with JGF and evolve it through several steps.

==Test Applications==

The following applications are included to test different components and to serve as examples.

|| Box || [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/data/box/box.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/box code] || The simplest example of a JGF application. ||
|| Console || [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/data/console/console.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/console code] || How to use JGF console. ||
|| GUI || [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/data/gui/gui.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/gui code] || The GUI system provides functionality for menus, HUDs and OSDs (text and images on screen). ||
|| Menu || [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/trunk/jgf/src/example/resources/menu/menu.xml config] - [http://code.google.com/p/jgf/source/browse/#svn/trunk/jgf/src/example/java/net/jgf/example/menu code] || Tests the (simple) default menu system. ||

Remember that components can always be extended or replaced if the default ones don't fit your needs.

==JGF Base Project Skeleton==

JGF base project skeleton makes starting a new JGF project a cut-and-paste matter. Includes Ant build script and libraries.

==Tanklet Game==

A complete game is included: [Tanklet]. Follow the link to learn more about it.
